CatDescriptText: Mr. Bill Eggins, 304 Reed Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that permitting children to work after school hours is detrimental to their general welfare--Health, school, and recreational time, etc?" answer reads: "I favor boys working more so than I do girls. However, if they come to school tired in mornings, they should give up the jobs.  The should know how much they can stand."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Bill Eggins wearing plaid hat, pencil moustache, and plaid shirt, standing on sidewalk of residential street with telephone poles and automobiles
